snippet.textDisplay: I personally liked this soundtrack. Yes the fact that they used pretty much one track and tweaked it to different sounds is just a shame without a doubt. There's no arguing there. Still a million times better than Yoshi's Island 2. As for the game, yes it is very easy with the Special Levels giving some challenge to a degree but it isn't that much. If you liked the Yoshi's Island series, then pick this up but not at $40. I personally enjoyed the game myself.
snippet.textOriginal: I personally liked this soundtrack. Yes the fact that they used pretty much one track and tweaked it to different sounds is just a shame without a doubt. There's no arguing there. Still a million times better than Yoshi's Island 2. As for the game, yes it is very easy with the Special Levels giving some challenge to a degree but it isn't that much. If you liked the Yoshi's Island series, then pick this up but not at $40. I personally enjoyed the game myself.

snippet.textDisplay: I think the game overall was decent enough, the problem was that it is WAY too easy or at least it was easy for me. I really didn't mind the soundtrack or the level design.
snippet.textOriginal: I think the game overall was decent enough, the problem was that it is WAY too easy or at least it was easy for me. I really didn't mind the soundtrack or the level design.

snippet.textDisplay:
Compared to this game, Yoshi's Island DS is a masterpiece.
I think that Nintendo should give up on the "Yoshi's Island" franchise, as the SNES game is, I think, unbeatable. Hell, the SNES hacks of the game are thousand times better than Yoshi's Island DS and Yoshi's New Island. I urge the fans to play it. SMW2+ and SMW2+2 are both superb. Kamek's Revenge is excellent too, but I recommend playing it with savestates, as it's really really hard.
snippet.textOriginal:

Hell, the SNES hacks of the game are thousand times better than Yoshi's Island DS and Yoshi's New Island. I urge the fans to play it. SMW2+ and SMW2+2 are both superb. Kamek's Revenge is excellent too, but I recommend playing it with savestates, as it's really really hard.

snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
Never said the original was hard, it's actually really damn easy, which is the only con I have with the game really (I don't hate the voice of baby Mario, it was made annoying on purpose so that you don't want to get hit), although it's kinda nitpicking because a game doesn't have to be hard to be great.
The extra levels in the game are great, it's worth unlocking them.
I can't remember how hard Kamek's Revenge is as I haven't played it in a while, but I remember SMW2+ being a really great rom, with SMW2+2 being even better, feels like an improvement in every section. It's a much more refined, polished game. Doesn't mean that SMW2+ is bad though. Both games have their ups and downs, I hope you play SMW2+2 soon.
Also, give SMW2+3 a try, it's probably my second favorite SMW romhack, the first being The Second Reality Project 2 Reloaded. Adding the third favorite so there's a top 3 - Mario Gives Up 1.
snippet.textOriginal:
Never said the original was hard, it's actually really damn easy, which is the only con I have with the game really (I don't hate the voice of baby Mario, it was made annoying on purpose so that you don't want to get hit), although it's kinda nitpicking because a game doesn't have to be hard to be great.
The extra levels in the game are great, it's worth unlocking them.
I can't remember how hard Kamek's Revenge is as I haven't played it in a while, but I remember SMW2+ being a really great rom, with SMW2+2 being even better, feels like an improvement in every section. It's a much more refined, polished game. Doesn't mean that SMW2+ is bad though. Both games have their ups and downs, I hope you play SMW2+2 soon.
Also, give SMW2+3 a try, it's probably my second favorite SMW romhack, the first being The Second Reality Project 2 Reloaded. Adding the third favorite so there's a top 3 - Mario Gives Up 1.

snippet.textDisplay:
+Happytreefriendsfan3 Oh look, a fellow ROM hacker/player on the comments section of a Youtube video. That's not something you see every day.

Also Yoshi's Island (the original) isn't even hard, I always found it was pretty easy. Then again though, I never bothered to the extra levels. The only one I played was the poochy one, and that level was really easy as well.

I disagree with SNN's Kamek's Revenge being hard as well. But SMW2+ is absolute win though, but I haven't played SMW2+2 yet.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm never buying this game. Why can't we get an actual sequel to YI and not just retreads with shit artstyle and music? This game looks even worse than YI DS.

Sure most Mario games have some variations of their main themes (Bomb omb battlefield, Delfino Plaza, Gusty Garden, SMG2 Main Theme, etc), but pretty much THE ENTIRETY OF THE SOUNDTRACK!? Absolutley inexcuseable.

snippet.textDisplay: The inhumane and god-awful title theme always makes me forget that there's a possibility that there are at least decent tracks in this game.

snippet.textDisplay: I played a little bit of this game, and... Uhg. The level design is linear and the animation&gameplay feels incredibly slow, compared to the tricky levels and floaty controls of Yoshi's Island DS.
snippet.textOriginal: I played a little bit of this game, and... Uhg. The level design is linear and the animation&gameplay feels incredibly slow, compared to the tricky levels and floaty controls of Yoshi's Island DS.

snippet.textDisplay: The motif itself is catchy, especially when you first listen to it in Level 1-1. But its variations range from average to just weird and unsuitable. The cave and castle music should be menacing but in this gsme they're too happy. Soundtrack is definitely one of Yoshi's New Island's weakpoints. Otherwise, it's an entertaining game to play.
snippet.textOriginal: The motif itself is catchy, especially when you first listen to it in Level 1-1. But its variations range from average to just weird and unsuitable. The cave and castle music should be menacing but in this gsme they're too happy. Soundtrack is definitely one of Yoshi's New Island's weakpoints. Otherwise, it's an entertaining game to play.

But this song is really good.

snippet.textDisplay: @Pander8874  Really? I hear the soundtrack was really hit or miss. And so far I've only heard the terrible songs.
snippet.textOriginal: @Pander8874  Really? I hear the soundtrack was really hit or miss. And so far I've only heard the terrible songs.

snippet.textDisplay: Masayoshi Ishi is no Koji Kondo, that's for sure. I think I like this soundtrack even less than Yoshi's Island DS'. The problem with both games' music is that the tracks are based on a single theme (something Kondo did himself, with a lot more subtlety) that's absolutely average and forgettable in the first place. I find both games have one rendition that stands above the rest: Windblown Wilderness for Yoshi's Island DS and Bandit Valley for this game. The guitar in this one makes it very pleasant to the ears.
snippet.textOriginal: Masayoshi Ishi is no Koji Kondo, that's for sure. I think I like this soundtrack even less than Yoshi's Island DS'. The problem with both games' music is that the tracks are based on a single theme (something Kondo did himself, with a lot more subtlety) that's absolutely average and forgettable in the first place. I find both games have one rendition that stands above the rest: Windblown Wilderness for Yoshi's Island DS and Bandit Valley for this game. The guitar in this one makes it very pleasant to the ears.

snippet.textDisplay:
I think the problem came from how obvious it was that each song used the same melody. It was just instant recognition. It worked in Super Mario World because it wasn't so extremely apparent that the same melody was used in each of the stage songs. Each iteration of the melody was varied so well in such a way that they seemed like completely different songs, and it was only as an after-thought that I realized (all that time ago) that it was the same melody.
I personally don't think New Island's music was as bad as YIDS. And it could've stood-up as pretty good if not for the use of the kazoos in certain songs. Not a lot, which was nice, but even the use in just one song was a bad enough impression to carry on throughout.
snippet.textOriginal:
I think the problem came from how obvious it was that each song used the same melody. It was just instant recognition. It worked in Super Mario World because it wasn't so extremely apparent that the same melody was used in each of the stage songs. Each iteration of the melody was varied so well in such a way that they seemed like completely different songs, and it was only as an after-thought that I realized (all that time ago) that it was the same melody.
I personally don't think New Island's music was as bad as YIDS. And it could've stood-up as pretty good if not for the use of the kazoos in certain songs. Not a lot, which was nice, but even the use in just one song was a bad enough impression to carry on throughout.
